Class SpectralSynthesizer

java.lang.Object
  SpectralSynthesizer

public class SpectralSynthesizer
extends java.lang.Object

A SpectralSynthesizer creates surfaces whose heights approximate fractional Brownian motion in two dimensions using the SpectralSynthesisFM2D algorithm from the book "The Science of Fractal Images".

Author:
Justin Johnson

Constructor Summary
SpectralSynthesizer(java.util.Random rand, FourierTransform fft)
          Creates a new SpectralSynthesizer.

Constructor Detail

SpectralSynthesizer

public SpectralSynthesizer(java.util.Random rand,
                           FourierTransform fft)
Creates a new SpectralSynthesizer.

Parameters:
rand - The random number generator to be used.
fft - The FourierTransform object to be used.
Method Detail

getSpectrum

public ComplexNumber[][] getSpectrum(int n,
                                     double h)
Computes the Fourier coefficients of a surface using the SpectralSynthesisFM2D algorithm.

Parameters:
n - The size of the surface to create. Must be a positive power of 2.
h - Controls the fractal dimension of the output; the output has fractal dimension D = 3 - h
Returns:
An array of complex numbers containing the Fourier coefficients of the surface.

getSurface

public double[][] getSurface(ComplexNumber[][] spectrum)
Computes the heights of a surface given its Fourier coefficients.

Parameters:
spectrum - The Fourier coefficients of the surface.
Returns:
An array of surface heights.

getSurface

public double[][] getSurface(int n,
                             double h)
Computes the heights of a fractal surface using the SpectralSynthesisFM2D algorithm.

Parameters:
n - The size of the surface to create. Must be a positive power of 2.
h - Controls the fractal dimension of the output; the output has fractal dimension D = 3 - h
Returns:
An array of surface heights.

filterSpectrum

public ComplexNumber[][] filterSpectrum(ComplexNumber[][] spectrum,
                                        int m)
Removes all but the m lowest order Fourier coefficients.

Parameters:
spectrum - The spectrum to filter.
m - The number of Fourier coefficients to retain.
Returns:
A copy of spectrum with all but the m lowest order coefficients set to zero.
